It is as if America is a drunk and veers left, then right constantly going to extreme positions. The radio talk show hosts constantly feed these fires and just won't get up off it. But they make very good money with very good benefits.Thanks

NEW YORK -- Young voters represented a greater share of the national electorate Tuesday than four years ago, once again voting for President Barack Obama by a huge margin, boosting his reelection. Voters from ages 18 to 29 represented 19 percent of all those who voted on Tuesday, according to the early National Exit Poll conducted by Edison Research. That's an increase of one percentage point from 2008. Obama captured 60 percent youth vote, compared with Mitt Romney's 36 percent.

this age group have little prospects anyway, unless their folks have it made and have connections (liberals in media for sure) but they voted for the food stamp president and so be it... many in the electorate are government dependent and never will voluntarily have subsidies removed...... it is fair to state that change HAS come and cash earned by "wagonpullers" will be redistributed... mho, but this does not bode well for industriousness, growth, and business.. wiser heads (over 40 or so) did not vote obama.
